content: शमः [शम्-घञ्] {@--1@} Quiet, tranquillity, calmness. {@--2@} Rest, calm, repose, cessation. {@--3@} Absence or restraint of passions, mental quietness, quietism; शमरतेऽमरतेजसि पार्थिवे <ls>R. 9. 4</ls>; <ls>Ki. 10. 10</ls>; <ls n="Ki.">16. 48</ls>, <ls>Śi. 2. 94</ls>; <ls>Bg. 10. 4.</ls> {@--4@} Allayment, mitigation, alleviation, satisfaction, pacification (of grief, thirst, hunger &c.); शममुपयातु ममापि चित्तदाहः <ls>U. 6. 8</ls>; शममेष्यति मम शोकः कथं नु वत्से <ls>Ś. 4. 20.</ls> {@--5@} Peace; as in शमोपन्यास <ls>Ve. 5.</ls> {@--6@} Final emancipation (from all worldly illusions and attachments). {@--7@} The hand.
